subject: AI
title: API Key Management
description: Secure storage and rotation of AI service API keys.

hook.text: A developer pushes code to GitHub. Buried in the commit: their OpenAI API key. Within hours, bots scrape it and rack up $2,000 in charges.

buildup.text: API keys are the passwords to AI services. They authenticate your app, track your usage, and bill your account. If someone else gets your key, they spend your money.

discovery.text: Store keys in environment variables (.env files), never in source code. Use .gitignore to exclude .env. In production, use secret managers (AWS Secrets Manager, Vault, Vercel env vars).

twist.text: Rotate keys regularly. If a key might be compromised, revoke it immediately from the provider's dashboard. Set up billing alerts so you catch abuse early.

climax.text: Good key hygiene: .env for local dev, secret manager for production, billing alerts for safety, and rotation schedules for peace of mind.

punchline.text: Treat API keys like passwords. Because that's exactly what they are.

quiz.question: Where should you store API keys in a production application?
options: In a secret manager or environment variables
